items.headline: Consumer spending is strong — and the U.S. economy is all right
items.summary_en: High tariffs, lingering inflation and more trouble finding a job apparently haven’t been enough to throw consumers into funk. Americans increased spending again in August to help keep the U.S. economy chugging.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: Fed’s Barkin upbeat on U.S. economic outlook despite rising inflation, slower job growth
